column3:
Hello kirankashyap,
welcome to Bitcoin Core :)

First please be sure to include a prefix to your pull request. Please change it to "doc: Improve contributor doc formatting and readability"

Also because of your requested review from fanquake. Please use the request review function **only** if you really know that THIS SPECIFIC person should review your PR but your PR could be reviewed by
Thanks for the comments. I have updated the title. \n\nI will make sure not to add reviewers hereafter.
Also be sure to squash your commits. There is a guide for it in the CONTRIBUTING.md file
> Also be sure to squash your commits. There is a guide for it in the CONTRIBUTING.md file\n\n@emilengler I just resubmitted a single commit instead of two.  Thanks for the guidance.

No problem.
But keep in mind that the `doc:` prefix also needs to be in the commit text.
To edit your commit message do:
```
git rebase -i HEAD~1
```
then edit the `pick` to `reword`
After this adjust the commit message and save it.
Finally:
```
git push origin patch-1 -f
```

Contact me on IRC if you need some sort of live chat support :D
@emilengler I just pushed the commit with revised commit text as suggested. Thanks for the suggestion
A sentence starting with `Even` looks a bit weird to me (I could be wrong, English isn't my mother tongue). Maybe move it back into brackets like it was before?
updated the changes as suggested. thanks for the suggestions.\n
